channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Add TThreadedSelectorServer for HBase Thrift2

Let's try a pre commit check.

Jian Yi Could you please change your full name to English(Jian Yi)? Not all peoples here can read or type Chinese so it is hard for them to mention you in jira.

Thanks.

-1 overall



Vote Subsystem Runtime Comment
0 reexec 0m 0s Docker mode activated.
-1 patch 0m 6s HBASE-17181 does not apply to master. Rebase required? Wrong Branch? See https://yetus.apache.org/documentation/0.3.0/precommit-patchnames for help.

This message was automatically generated.

Jian Yi Please prepare a patch for master first. All changes should go into master first, and then backport to other branches.

Thanks.

284		    if (workerThreads > 0)

285		    	serverArgs.workerThreads(workerThreads);

Please use curly braces around the method call.

Is it possible to add unit test where the threaded selector server is exercised ?

I compiled it on 1.2.3, I meet compile error on master:

without similar unit test in TestThriftHBaseServiceHandler.java about Server, I compile and test it on 1.2.3 version online.

patch for master

source code file based on master
Just to say there's no harm in us getting used to handling chinese ideograms. Its good for us over on this end of the world.

Can you post a difference from master, a patch, rather than files so we can see what has changed Jian Yi? This section from the hbase refguide tries to lead you through how (there is some nice tooling to help you): http://hbase.apache.org/book.html#submitting.patches.create. If you want to learn more about how hbase does formatting, etc., there is http://hbase.apache.org/book.html#developer. Thanks Jian Yi
Create patch by dev-support/submit-patch.py
Thanks

Jian Yi You can make a commit locally and the commit message should be

HBASE-17181 Let HBase thrift2 support TThreadedSelectorServer

And then use git format-patch to generate the patch

git format-patch HEAD^ --stdout > HBASE-17181-vx.patch

In this way I can use git am --signoff to apply your patch and keep the author information.

Thanks.

empty path file, using:
git format-patch HEAD^ --stdout > HBASE-17181-vx.patch

use dev-support\submit-patch.py is ok:
git add hbase-thrift\src\main\java\org\apache\hadoop\hbase\thrift2\ThriftServer.java
git commit -m "HBASE-17181 Let HBase thrift2 support TThreadedSelectorServer"
dev-support\submit-patch.py
HBASE-17181 Let HBase thrift2 support TThreadedSelectorServer

how to solve the following error:

The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests. Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch. Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

Start command:
bin/hbase-daemon.sh start thrift2 --framed --selector --selectors 5 --workers 30
Will commit later if no objection.

Jian Yi Could you please prepare a patch for branch-1.2? It seems that there is no callQueueSize config in branch-1.2.

Thanks.
I test it on 1.2.3 online service
How to create patch with 1.2.3 if sources are not cloned from git downloaded directly.

You can generate a patch from your inhouse repo first, and then apply it to the offical 1.2 branch(the name is branch-1.2). Fix conflicts if any, and then generate the patch with git format-patch(I do not know whether the submit-patch.py works on branch-1.2, you can try).

Thanks for your patience.

Let's finish the issue first.

Jian Yi Feel free to open a new backport issue to backport the changes to branch-1.2 or any other branches.

Thanks.

Pushed to master and branch-1.

Thanks Jian Yi for the contribution. Thanks all for reviewing.
